data.title: komunitas belajar bahasa jepang
data.meta_description: Pos tentang inggris yang ditulis oleh yohanpuri
data.text:
maaf halaman download-nya belum jadi juga hehehe ^^ datanya saia list berdasarkan abjad, jadi bukan berdasar file terbaru yg di upload. beberapa saya uji coba di bawah ini

silakan coba di donlod. tolong beri konfirmasi jika download berhasil ataupun ga ya…. di sini kamu bisa download gratis MP3 WMA atau file lain baik itu musik ( J-Pop, J-rock, japan song ataw yang bukan jepang, atau apa aja kalo ada yg request, dangdut juga boleh.. halah.. 😛 it’s 100 % free ^^ downloads)

oh, iya… request yang berisi pujian, sanjungan…. dan rayuan2 buat saia, akan lebih duluan di approve dari pada yang ga pake muji-muji dulu, heheheh :p

satu lagi, karena sebenernya model download file musik MP3 yg punya copyright dalam bentuk apapun itu dilarang (kecuali: beli yg asli!), maka ga usah ngomong ke sapa2 yak 😛 dosa karena udah download silakan ditanggung sendiri ^^

On that day, they filmed for both the “Journey” and “Endless Story” performance. The second half of this clip, is the whole “TRAPNEST” performance for “Endless Story.”)

Pureyes MTV Advance Interview ( In this video clip, you see Yuna in the studios singing “Pureyes” and practicing it. Afterwards, Yuna expresses in her own words what “Pureyes” means.)

Faith – Official YunaWeb Commentary

credit to: Mika Nakashima@solid07forums.net & soulsteelgray.wordpress.com

[single] ASIAN KUNG-FU GENERATION – Aru Machi no Gunjou (2006.11.29)

1. Aru Machi no Gunjou

2. Kugenuma Surf

If ELLEGARDEN is the Japanese band with a distinctly American sound, then ASIAN KUNG-FU GENERATION is the Japanese band with a sound that is clearly a product of Japan. To tell the truth, I find the differences between the two bands quite interesting. Both have their own unique sound and that makes listening to their music all the more enjoyable because they draw on different influences. Even though Blackout wasn¡¯t a single, I¡¯m going to keep comparing all of AKFG¡¯s singles to it until they can somehow manage to surpass the quality of Blackout. Aru Machi no Gunjou is great¨Cand Kugenuma Surf is just as enjoyable, if not more, than the A-side¨Cbut, of course, it doesn¡¯t match up to Blackout.

Rating: 8.5/10

Download

Believe it or not, Feedback File is worth a listen. Logically, an album of B-sides means ¡°an album of tracks that weren¡¯t good enough for inclusion on an album,¡± but I¡¯ve usually found AKFG¡¯s B-sides to be rather enjoyable. Since Feedback File doesn¡¯t have all of their B-sides, it¡¯s safe to assume that AKFG chose the best of their B-sides to put on the album. And hey, if you haven¡¯t heard some of these songs before, then it¡¯s almost like downloading a new album (there¡¯s always the live tracks, too).

Rating: 8.5/10

The last song from AKFG that truly wowed me was Blackout. That said, Aru Machi no Gunjou is still a pretty good song. The PV isn¡¯t anything particularly awe-inspiring or anything of that sort, but I suppose it takes after the name of the song well.

[PV] ASIAN KUNG-FU GENERATION – Kaiga Kyoushitsu (2006.10.25)

AKFG¡¯s last new offering, Juuni Shinhou no Yuukei, didn¡¯t exactly wow me. In that vein, Kaiga Kyoushitsu doesn¡¯t wow me either. There¡¯s something missing from it that makes it seem boring in comparison to previous songs. It¡¯s not really a single (just like Juuni Shinhou no Yuukei), so I guess I can let its so-so quality slide, but I¡¯m wondering where the days of Sol-fa went.

[19th single] CHEMISTRY – Top of the World (2006.12.06)

1. Top of the World

2. 10 Minutes of CHEMISTRY

3. Top of the World ¡¸Less Vocal¡¹

I¡¯m not quite sure I understand CHEMISTRY¡¯s reasoning behind including Top of the World on ALL THE BEST and then releasing it as a single a couple of weeks later. I guess it kind of doesn¡¯t matter because Top of the World is a pretty good song, definitely the kind of material I enjoy hearing from CHEMISTRY. The B-side is nothing more than a 10-minute medley of CHEMISTRY¡¯s singles. Yeah, it¡¯s a little cheap, but I liked it all the same.

Rating: 8.5/10

Download

[18th single] CHEMISTRY – Tookage feat. John Legend (2006.11.01)

1. Tookage feat. John Legend

2. Christmas Rose

3. Yakusoku no Basho (Kuricorder Quartet sepia color mix)

4. Tookage feat. John Legend (Instrumental)

Admittedly, I like Tookage a lot better on my second listen, but it¡¯s still sort of boring. Christmas Rose kind of makes the single a bit better overall and the Yakusoku no Basho remix is fairly interesting. I can¡¯t say I prefer the remix over the original, but listening to it made me realize exactly how oddball the arrangement of the original is in the first place.

Rating: 6.5/10

Download

[17th single] CHEMISTRY – Yakusoku no Basho (2006.10.04)

1. Yakusoku no Basho

2. still in my heart

3. YOUR WORLD

4. Yakusoku no Basho [Less Vocal]

When compared to Tookage, Yakusoku no Basho is a way better song. It¡¯s not one of their best songs, but it gets the job done. still in my heart and YOUR WORLD are pretty good B-sides, too. But really, we need another upbeat single from them (preferably along the lines of Densetsu no Sougen, which was an excellent song that I think should¡¯ve been a single).

Rating: 7.5/10
